titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Robert F. Williams [sound recording] : self-defense, self-respect, & self-determination / as told by Mabel Williams.

profiledesc.creation: Encoded finding aid created from MARC record by Dallas Pillen
profiledesc.langusage: The finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Robert F. Williams [sound recording] : self-defense, self-respect, & self-determination / as told by Mabel Williams.

odd.head: Date/Time and Place of Event
odd.p: Recorded in Oakland, California by AK Press Audio; distributed by Mordam Records/Alternative Tentacles.

odd.head: Publication, Distribution, Etc.
odd.p: San Francisco, CA : Freedom Archives, c2005.

odd.head: Creation/Production Credits
odd.p: Reseach and production by Andres Alegria, Lincoln Bergman, Rachel Herzing, Claude Marks & Sele Nadel-Hayes. Master & sound sweetening by Greg Landau & John Greenham.

odd.head: Formatted Contents Note
odd.p: Introduction (1:38) -- The Williams' beginnings (4:12) -- The American tradition of freedom through guns (2:03) -- Organizing the NAACP against segregation in Monroe (1955-1961) (2:26) -- Armed self-defense as a right (3:28) -- The rifle club and the 10-point program (1957) (1:50) -- The Crusader newsletter (1959 on) (1:17) -- Racism, blackness, and the "kissing" case (1958-59) (2:45) -- The relationship with Malcolm X (1959/60) (1:48) -- The Cuban revolution (1959 on) (3:36) -- The swimming pool desegragation campaign (1957-1961) (2:11) -- The KKK mobilizes and attacks Monroe (4:05) -- Klan attempts to kill Robert (1961) (2:14) -- The Freedome Riders come to Monroe (1961) (1:27) -- The so-called kidnapping and leaving Monroe (1961) (6:15) -- To Cuba and the Crusader in exile (1961 on) (2:50) -- Radio Free Dixie (1962-1965) (3:26) -- The Birmingham church bombing - from Radio Free Dixie (1963) (5:04) -- The age of revolution and urban rebellion (3:28) -- China, the Soviet Union, and transition (4:45) -- Black power speech (1966) (2:21) -- The Vietnam War and black liberation (4:16) -- Tanzania and repatriation (1968/69) (2:57) -- Homecoming (1969) (2:44) -- Postscript - The struggle continues (2:15).

odd.head: General Note
odd.p: Accompanied by Robert and Mabel Williams resource guide.

archdesc.scopecontent: Tells the story of Robert Williams through an exclusive interview with his widow, Mabel Williams. Features rare speeches, interviews and radio broadcasts of Radio Free Dixie.
